title: BEST COMPUTER FOR LOL
body:
I need a laptop or computer for league because right now I'm playing on a 2010 IMac which is pretty bad and slow. I want a predator cause I heard they have some connection to lol and because they are good. My budget is $0-$1000 i could go about $200 more but again as I said I need help choosing one. Can you give me your opinion and the cons and pros on the computer. Remember I want a predator.
Thanks

replies.body: Im in the same boat, my Mac is unplayable and need a PC in a bad way

Easy, just go on Gumtree and search for league computer. Should get a really good one for under $500.

Edit: oh wait you're from NA
Build yourself one, its satisfying once its complete, just ask your tech store, about all the techno talk that comes with each piece

Build your own.

The thing with pre-built systems is that a) you generally pay for the price of the parts + an extra several hundred $$, and b) you generally can't upgrade pre-built systems without either voiding the warranty or having to pay a licensed service centre to do the upgrade for you so as to not void the warranty.

You can build a pretty decent system for ~$1400.
I never built my own so do you know a vid on youtube I can see?
Building a PC is fairly plug-and-play nowadays. As long as you have compatible parts (see the list I provided below) you could get it done in a few hours.

https://au.pcpartpicker.com/list/nV8bbj

That took all of 5 minutes to come up with.

It's a solid build to start off with. Good Motherboard & CPU - everything else is relatively inexpensive so it's not a huge deal if/when you want to upgrade (add additional RAM, storage, better GPU).

https://imgur.com/CTrtVjH

https://imgur.com/F5vOsJk

My PC {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

you only need a computer which can give you a minimum of 60 fps. Above 60 fps makes no differences and really a waste of money. Unless you are a pro streamer you want a bit higher but for casual gamers, I would say around 70-80 fps 
easy core i5 8GB ram mid-range motherboard and a decent graphics card (GTX 970,980,1070,1080), a hard drive of course and you are ready to rock and roll
This build will probably cost you around $1000 or $1100 but it is way much better than a $1500-$2000 laptop in terms of gaming capability
any suggestions on a particular computer/laptop?

I'm pretty sure when you walk into a store or call them up asking about how to build a good gaming rig, they will probably give you few good pieces of advice
I can suggest you different companies like PCCaseGear (Melb) or Mwave (Syd)
